column5: LOL The walk out was superb. Well,crossing the pressure crack this morning was a bit of a challenge.  Finding a spot to cross was a bit of a chore,but made it. Started 1st hole shallow, marked nothing. Moved to next spot, drill and never moved the rest of the morning. The glory hole. 	They were there the whole time. So many dinks  . Then, I figured out a pattern. These buggers were coming up with shiners in their mouths. They are chasing. SO, i played the chase game. Man it was the ticket. Drop,bang,lift,stop,they come up ,reel  and fish on.LOL Some chased from 25 up to 10 and then hit. It was a blast. I left and they were still there, but I had my fun and my fresh feed. The 2 baits used were a  3"williams half and half hammer with a 3" drop line to a hook with a trout trigger X bead. The other was a small buckshot. Man that thing is deadly. Perch,n is so much fun.
sure were a lot of shiners, i think thats about the last time trying to make it over the pressure cracks for my yamadoo
See ya in the AM for a nice brisk walk. It,s a hop,skip and a jump,then it,s occupation yellow hues.
me walk  pulling a hut you know I'm retired right lol
Going light. You can sit on the milk crate and I will pull you out. Just hang on going over the BIG crack. OOPS.
From Whitie Whisper to Perch Whisper
LOL He was a Jones today. No show.LOL  What a day a difference makes. I was yelling,not whispering.LOL They were not as active,but did manage a few for some eats.
Genz Worm Jigs........  10 thousand perch and counting................since some time in the 90s, and including Cook's Bay.  Tip it with a perch eye.
Yesterday I was fishing for perch on ten inches of pretty good ice, but left when the wind hit about 50 kph.  This morning that ice is GONE.
